content: Whose fathers I disdained to put with the dogs of my flock.
Indeed, what  is the strength of their hands to me?
Fleeing late to the wilderness, desolate and waste,
Who pluck mallow by the bushes,
And broom tree roots  their food.
They were driven out from among
They shouted at them as  a thief.
to live in the clefts of the valleys,
caves of the earth and the rocks.
They were scourged from the land.
